It is where the motor area is destroyed, more 
particularly in the neighbourhood of the fissure of 
Rolando, that descending secondary degeneration 
occurs. In fact I question very much whether 
the callosal fibres are subject to trophic nerve 
cell action at all. I have not had sufficient 
experience as yet to make any definite statement 
on the subject, but what I have seen predisposes me 
to believe that they are not.
